website_summaries.verdict: The Asus Zenbook Prime UX31A-R5102F offers a good looking ultrabook, and ups the ante with a 1080p display and third-generation Intel processor.

customer_reviews.title: A lemon
customer_reviews.text: This machine was for my wife, and it was nothing but trouble. First the sound stopped working. Before long the keyboard stopped working correctly. I researched online, and found out you have to pop it open and reseat the keyboard plug on the motherboard on a regular basis. This is a common problem. Then the pin broke off in the power port. It was such a tiny pin. I re-soldered a new pin, and it worked again for a little while. Eventually the machine just stopped working altogether. Meanwhile my daughter and I have Toshiba laptops we were using long before this thing, and they still work great long after with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: JohnM

customer_reviews.title: A great laptop overall.
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful computer and one of the best laptops I've owned. We now own two of them actually. It just feels like a quality piece of hardware. Incredibly thin, light, great screen, great keyboard. The only negatives are that the memory is not upgradeable, and we did have an issue with the keyboard not working briefly which turned out to be a common issue with the keyboard cable getting disconnected. That was an easy fix with a piece of tape (but I did have to buy a special screwdriver to open it up).
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop, you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is exactlyu as described by the many reviews I have read prior to purchasing this product. All the shortcomings were solved and nice enhancements added, compared to the previous version. There was a slight touchpad a and typing problem when I got it but a quick driver update from ASUS's website solved both. I can't say anything that would be a minus. Its fast, reliable, the display is not glaring, sharp and perfect, light and battery life is great. I wouldn't change anything on it, except maybe a better upgradeability but I guess that would be hard to do with such a slim design. All my friends are amazed when they see it :)
customer_reviews.author: Bohdan Sienkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this laptop! I've had a lot of computers through the years, but this one by far takes the cake. Excellent for software development anywhere you go - battery lasts nearly forever. My only issue, which could have been solved with a little more research on my part, is the inability to upgrade the RAM. I purchased the 4GB model planning to upgrade as necessary, however, memory modules are soldered directly to the motherboard. Still works great, but don't plan to run Eclipse or a similar IDE with a whole pile of tabs in your browser and the Android emulator at the same time. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Grant Pearson

customer_reviews.title: VERY proprietary and parts are scarce
customer_reviews.text: Be sure and don't damage your zenbook in any way. ASUS will choose whether or not to honor their accidental damage warranty for your particular model and if not, you get to pay them not just for parts but for their labor to fix it. They will not sell you parts to fix it yourself. I ended up having to purchase a replacement keyboard(yes my fault for ruining it) from Sweden. It's the ONLY place I was able to find a replacement keyboard. Oh and the SSD, hope you never want to upgrade it, it's also rare and of a proprietary interface. At least you can find a replacement SSD for a MacBook Air and they invented proprietary!
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this...
customer_reviews.text: It's beautiful to look at and light as a feather to carry around, but it's been nothing but trouble. Had to return it to ASUS within 30 days to rebalance keyboard that kept going out of control of its own accord. Then the hard drive crashed and had to send it back again. Now the thing won't power up, even when plugged into AC adaptor (which shows green indicator lights, so appears to be working.) DON'T BE TEMPTED BY ITS PRETTINESS - this thing is UGLY where it counts!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: KarenB

customer_reviews.title: Very good laptop
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this laptop after my old laptop died on me. I mainly use my laptops for coding and some mild gaming. Mine came with Windows 7 but let's be honest the OS takes so much room in the SSD it almost seems like a waste of SSD, so I switched to linux which only took about a couple hundred megabytes of space. I love this slick looking laptop, it is very fast overall, only takes a couple of seconds to boot up and it is very light, which takes loads off my carrying case comparing to the old one I had.
customer_reviews.author: Zingy

customer_reviews.title: The keys just stop working......whenever they want
customer_reviews.text: I really love the screen and long battery life! But the problem with the keyboard has forced me to get an external keyboard and mouse. I even had to take the password protection off the computer due to being shut out on many occasions. If I didn't have so much time and money invested in software and such this thing would be in the trash right now. It took a few months for the issues to start showing up and things got worse and worse and worse. Do not buy!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Science Minded

customer_reviews.title: Beauty is only skin deep!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop looks great, sleek and shiny, but has keyboard and electrical problems. After spending $1100 to purchase, I've had to spend an additional $200 in repairs. First repair, the unit went dark for no apparent reason ($120.00) and local repair shop fixed. Second repair, keyboard began acting up one week before the unit went dark, again ($80). DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT if you need a dependable laptop computer.
customer_reviews.author: Aldocella

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard keeps breaking
customer_reviews.text: The screen is pretty but.. 1) I've mailed in my computer 3 times in the past 2 months because random keys stop working, each time they fix it, it rebreaks 2) Periodically the screen spazzes out and you have to restart the computer - typically when too many excel docs are open 3) Touchpad still hard to use after a year 4) If you get this, be sure to get SquareTrade. They are amazing and refunding me the full cost of this POS laptop.
customer_reviews.author: HiThere

customer_reviews.title: Great ultrabook!
customer_reviews.text: The day I booted it up, I knew Windows was not for me. I installed Ubuntu 12.10 and haven't looked back. All of the hardware works find and Linux is very snappy on this machine. It is extremely light and this is the main reason I purchased it. I travel a lot and carrying around a 4 pound (more like 7 with power brick and extended battery) was out of the question. Video also looks stunning on the display. Would recommend again. I hope that Asus keeps the form factor for a while and keeps upgrading specs while reducing or keeping the weight the same.
customer_reviews.author: Kiran Rajendran

customer_reviews.title: The perfect laptop
customer_reviews.text: After months of searching for the right laptop for me, I came across the ASUS Zenbook Prime. Everything looked good on paper, but when I purchased it this laptop exceeded even my lofty expectations. I had heard some mixed reviews about the keyboard, but it has performed flawlessly for me at around 85-90 wpm, and I love the various useful shortcuts and backlighting aesthetics. With the faster processor, I did get worried about heat, but so far have not had anything above what is to be expected from a faster laptop. This computer responds extremely well and is extremely portable. Battery life and screen quality also both exceeded expectations. I give this laptop my highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Seanathan

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Zenbook Prime UX31A-DB51 13.3-Inch Ultrabook
customer_reviews.text: I experienced multiple issues with this product. All of the issues were intermittent, making them most frustrating. They are: 1) groups of keys on the key pad would not function; 2) one of the USB ports would not function; 3) the HDMI produced audio only with no video. Like I said, sometimes these devices would work normally, but not always. I have returned the Zenbook to ASUS for service. We will see what happens. The Zenbook has many impressive and useful features when it is working.
customer_reviews.author: steveson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this computer.
customer_reviews.text: This computer looks and sounds terrific on paper, but in practice it is has really been a big disappointment. The build quality is not what you would expect on a +1000 dollar laptop. Furthermore if something goes wrong their customer support is worse than any other I have ever encountered and that's really saying something considering the low bar that is generally set for electronics RMA/product support people. Bottom line is you should steer clear of this product unless you aspire to be emailing back and forth with some guy in China who is speaking in broken English about giving you an RMA number and sending your unit in for repairs.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: great ultrabook
customer_reviews.text: Great ultrabook, moving from macbook pro to ultrabook. It is worth the move. Summary: Super fast - thanks to ivybridge processor (3rd gen core processor) & SSD HD Excellent resolution (1920x1080) Slim and Light(2.9 pounds) looks great with metal finish The edges are very smooth and easy on your hands, very nice to carry around. Instant ON and Always connected features of ultrabook is very nice. Touch screen and win8 are the 2 features missing. I will upgrade to Win8 soon (Oct 26th?), but have to wait for touch screen until next upgrade. I highly recommend this product for anyone who can't wait till Nov when the touch screen ultrabooks will be showing up.
customer_reviews.author: K. Regupathy

customer_reviews.title: It totally malfunctioned once booted up
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this a week after It arrived. It totally malfunctioned once booted up. The D key never worked and the track pad was disaster. Update 3/24/2014 I bought ain February 2014, works with no flaws.
customer_reviews.author: +Fred Evans

customer_reviews.title: Bought Used with One bad flaw
customer_reviews.text: The A/C adapter plug is VERY touchy. So I am sure the first owner broke it. I will have to get this repaired eventually. This one had the SanDisk SSD, which I read is not as fast as the other that might come with it, but the performance really seems okay after having lived with a 2004 hp pavilion for almost 10 years. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: disappointing product, inept customer service
customer_reviews.text: The laptop was great for 2 months until the battery died and it wouldn't hold the charge. I had to return the product, and it's been with customer service for over 1 month. Their customer service department has proved to be completely incompetent and unresponsive. My initial plan was to buy two, one for myself, and a second for my girl friend. Glad I only bought the one. My girl friend will be buying another model, needless to say. Will update the post once the product is returned and how the quality progresses.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine D. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Nice when you put an SSD and 10GB of memory in it.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these models. The UX31A-AB71 and the UX32VD-DB71. The UX31A is flawless, lightweight and sleek.. The UX32 has one bad pixel which makes me angry, but the resolution is so high on this thing you really have to look for it. After putting in a SSD and 10GB of memory, I'm quite happy with the UX32 even thought it's thicker than the UX31.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lehrer

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk...
customer_reviews.text: When I saw the packaging, I'm not going to lie... the first thing I noticed was a little white sticker that said, "SanDisk SSD" Then I was pleased to see that the core i7 is 1.9GHz instead of the listed 1.7GHz. Storage is a little on the low side (68GB free) I'm considering throwing in a larger capacity SSD in the near future so I guess the SanDisk doesn't bother me TOO much; I think I got what I paid for... my only complaint is the SSD capacity. Other than that, beautiful product by ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Brahiem

customer_reviews.title: It needs a severe upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Major crap! Touchpad was an abortion, the cursor jumping all over the place, and no way to follow a screen or scroll. Go near the touchpad (like 2" and the cursor jumps around.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Howard

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had read the description better.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the Windows 7m didn't realize it was for gaming and had hardly any memory. Had to buy a monitor and separate keyboard. Very fast though. I would have to pay a huge restocking fee
customer_reviews.author: Judith Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A great ultrabook
customer_reviews.text: Everything you could want in an ultrabook - light, slim, powerful. It came loaded with Windows 7 Home Premium and I now have it dual booting with Ubuntu Linux. In both operating systems, everything works great straight out of the box. Other reviewers have complained about the touchpad, but presumably ASUS have fixed this - it is great. Don't waste your money on a Mac Airbook, the Zenbook with Core i7 and 256Gbyte SSD is top of the range.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Bover

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife. She LOVES it. This is her first laptop. It is beautiful, the i7 is fast, and the screen is sharp. I think in hindsight, there was no need for the i7 as she is not a power user, and it probably just shortens battery life. She had some problem with the mouse pad becoming non-responsive, but I helped her over the phone update a driver (Frankly, I'm not sure it was a mouse or user (ahem) problem, although I won't tell her that).
customer_reviews.author: Susan C. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: A standard
customer_reviews.text: I went from a $2000 Sony business laptop to this and I was still impressed. The build is sturdy, the multitasking/processing is fast, trackpad with the new driver works like any other laptop's. Medium sized videogames works and looks pretty good on this, as well as 1080p videos. Battery goes from 5-7 hours for internet browsing with powerpoint use. Basically, unless you're a diehard apple fan or must have it 2mm thinner, this > macbook air.
customer_reviews.author: Iridia

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished was like new
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this refurbished item at a significant savings. It had much of the orginal wrapping on the machine and accessories. It's the lightweight, thin personal computer for which we were looking so we are very pleased with the product and purchase process through Amazon. We've had great success purchasing refurbished small appliances and encourage others to consider it as a very cost effective option.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Zippy

customer_reviews.title: Great except for the backlight bleed!
customer_reviews.text: The design is great, sleek and light. The screen looks amazing with such a pixel density but the bleeding along the bottom is killing me. I work in the terminal on linux with a black background. This makes the backlight bleed a nuisance and for the price is unacceptable. I am considering exchanging it and if that does not work I will return it and purchase the Lenovo X1 Carbon that comes out next month. I really don't want to have to RMA it as I need a laptop for work and soon school. Especially without a guarantee that it is fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard problems
customer_reviews.text: Only had this unit for a couple of weeks. Very bizarre problem with cursor skipping around the screen randomly as you type, seems to be worse on the left lower side of the keyboard. Leads to deleted text and lost key strokes. HA! Just lost another two lines of text while typing this review!!! Seems to be numerous complaints about keyboard quality issues of various types. Trying to get ASUS to repair.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Going strong after 4 years.
customer_reviews.text: 4 years later and I still love this ultrabook. I'm actually looking for a second (exact model/submodel) for my SO as we speak.
customer_reviews.author: S. Benoit

customer_reviews.title: Great notebook. Keeping it.
customer_reviews.text: Great notebook from get go. Would have liked a standard connector for Ethernet, but given a very thin profile its understandable. Screen is awesome. Power adapter very small as opposed to bulky ones for other notebooks. Trackpad is much better than some other trackpads from Elan in other notebooks. Keyboard is a bit jumpy but overall satisfactory. Fan noise is minimal and core i5 version seems to be optimal in performance.
customer_reviews.author: Apozean

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard problems
customer_reviews.text: Every day one of about 10 keys, including the space bar becomes unresponsive. Thus I have resorted to carrying my Zenbook around along with an external keyboard (that is larger than the zenbook itself). Until Zenbook amends this issue which I read online is prevalent I cannot recomend it. Otherwise I would give a good ranking.
customer_reviews.author: Allen C Collinsworth

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and still going!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this laptop when it first came out. Been using it daily for the last three years with no issues. A powerful machine that is small and lightweight enough to take with me everywhere. Looking forward to using this laptop for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Mahva Naghipor

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. The first unit I received would not power ...
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. The first unit I received would not power on. On the new unit the "c" key stopped working after 15 months. Contacted ASUS and was told it was too bad the warranty is only 12 months. I would avoid doing business with this company.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: After two years, keyboard died on me. Nonetheless ...
customer_reviews.text: After two years, keyboard died on me. Nonetheless it still has the most fluid and responsive experience from any laptop I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Ardila

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. Everything about this product is just perfect (except for the Bloatware of course). I am using it with 2 monitors and it works beautifully. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Now!
customer_reviews.text: What else can I add to all other positive reviews of this beautiful piece of technology? Bravo ASUS for making it happen - would be too formal, but well-deserved. The anti-glare display of this item is simply amazing with Kindle-like qualities. Everything looks and feels perfect. It is a masterfully designed machine, perfectly described by its name - Zenbook. It enlightens and inspires me like Zen should. Can you hear the clap of one hand?! Well, I join others in expressing my gratitude to ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: ZenMan

customer_reviews.title: SSD is prone to failure.
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop, except the SSD is either slow or prone to complete failure (there are 2 SSD manufacturers, and you won't know which one you got until you open the box). Figured an SSD would be more reliable than the old fashioned HDD, but apparently that's not the case here. Looking forward to fixing this...
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Asus Zenbook
customer_reviews.text: Great computer, more than adequate speed and space. Its all that I expected and more. Slim design and light weight make it a winner
customer_reviews.author: John.M. Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit wary after reading some of the reviews about defective screens and keyboards. So far everything seems to be in perfect working order. The screen is great, all keys are in working order. 128gb hdd seems a bit small though, only 67gb is available.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Product Issue.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 times for this product. First time it was pixel screen issue in brand new item. 2nd time I bought used like new it look new but 5 keys even Enter Key, back space key , M key and two others was not working that's I have to returned. Product look very great and I don't know why it was happen. Manufacturer should Quality Control and increase sample size or Certified stock with 3rd party. I am supplier Quality Engineer last 10 year--Shahzad Umar
customer_reviews.author: SHAHZAD UMAR

customer_reviews.title: One of the greatest Ultrabook I know
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Super strong and fast. Works well. Upgrade to Windows 8 was a bit annoying, but it works great. If you are looking for a Windows laptop - this is the laptop for you!
customer_reviews.author: Eran Sandler

customer_reviews.title: Can't think of a better, Win 7 based ultrabook
customer_reviews.text: Love this ultrabook. Wouldn't get any other. Did have to invoke the warranty for some issues at the beginning, but once that was out of the way it has worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, beautiful and veeeery fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, very nice look, futuristic design...I have a macbook air and it eats dirt compared with this ultrabook. After update the touchpad software at ASUS download center, it works perfectly. Highly recomended
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo

customer_reviews.title: God damn track pad
customer_reviews.text: The overall computer is awesome. I use it for school and my research program analysis programs and it is very functional. Great screen resolution, runs quickly, super light weight, and overall great spread. The mother trucking trackpad bites though. Definitely had to get a mouse, which is fine considering I only use it professionally at my desk generally anyway. It is simply a mild annoyance every now and again.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Super Portable
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop, ultra portable. The power packed into the small chassis (dual core i5 and 128Gb SSD) really makes is shine, while the above average battery life makes it even more useful on the run. The 10-point touchpad needs some adjustment (out of the box it is overly sensitive), but it is nice to have a responsive touch surface. Mine came with Windows 7, which at this point I prefer to Windows 8. However, the 10-point touch pad would work well with the touch-interface of 8. Liked it enough that I got a second one as a gift to my parents.
customer_reviews.author: Peter G.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the savings to get openbox via market place
customer_reviews.text: Love the computer but I chose to save $300 by buying via Marketplace form a re-seller of open box/returned / factory refurbished items. when will I ever learn. the keyboard has intermittent issues where some keys dont press. I spent hours installing things before i realized that was a hardware rather than software issue and isnt going away. very annoying, just pay full price and get one that works.
customer_reviews.author: BigRedAbraham

customer_reviews.title: Cant turn it on
customer_reviews.text: Bad service! I returned the laptop after 1 day "using" as it even could't turn on (the battery was fully charged). Also I cant contact with the seller as I still haven't received response! I still waiting on my money back to my account (near 2 weeks) Natalia
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Bad Keyboard all around.
customer_reviews.text: this laptop has major problems. you do not have to take my word for it. go to google and search "Zenbook Keyboard Problems". you will see so many people have random keys on their keyboard not working. the solution? one person on youtube said that one must open the back of the laptop each time and push the keyboard cable back into place. (and he claimed it happens every two weeks, depending on if the laptop was tossed around or not. sending it back. will try dell xps. (also, stay away from the Lenovo Twist)
customer_reviews.author: Soheil Sahimi

customer_reviews.title: I wish there were pictures
customer_reviews.text: It was scratched up on the lid cover. It said refurbished and I totally understand what that can mean so I gave this a 4/5 only because it works as expected. Other than that, some pictures would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: ultra nice
customer_reviews.text: love the slick & light design. it's super fast and the screen is so pretty. downfalls are no cd-rom drive and only two usb ports.
customer_reviews.author: Mey Saechao

customer_reviews.title: Please please don't buy this laptop. Overpriced; Overly ...
customer_reviews.text: Please please don't buy this laptop. Overpriced; Overly sensitive trackpad; after only 2 years, the keyboard stopped working...I had to pound certain letter really hard to input. I wish I didn't make the purchase...
customer_reviews.author: Sai Zou

customer_reviews.title: ASUS
customer_reviews.text: This is the lightest lap top I have ever carried. Couldn't be happier with the size, the speed and the screen clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Shella P Marksberry

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard problem
customer_reviews.text: Asus knows about this problem but has not taken care of it. I had a computer tech at work follow instructions found on the Asus forum to fix it but he said it would likely happen again in the future. That is disappointing. Otherwise it is a slick machine.
customer_reviews.author: PFG

customer_reviews.title: I am a very happy camper !
customer_reviews.text: It's beautiful, light, thin and fast ! I love the fact that it has a matte Full HD screen, Windows 7 64-bit OS so I didn't have to learn to use Win 8. A few slightly negative things like only 2 USB ports and not being able to expand the internal RAM memory or the 128GB SSD, but all in all a very good buy !
customer_reviews.author: Franky

customer_reviews.title: it's aesthetically beautiful but performance is sketchy
customer_reviews.text: The laptop arrived in good condition. However, it was not as fast as I was led to believe by the i7 processor. I am wondering if it is the slower memory as some other reviewers had posted.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Mallqui

customer_reviews.title: ASUS UX31A-DB71
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an ASUS UX31A-DB71 for use on trips to Europe, etc. We just returned from Norway, and the ASUS performance was great. It is like having a desktop PC on a trip, with its I7 processor, big 13.3" screen, SS drive, and memory. I also like the backlit keyboard, which allows use in a darkened hotel room so that my wife can sleep.
customer_reviews.author: billd

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It is light, sleek, fast and the battery delivers! Just what I was looking for! Cool sleeve provided, great for traveling!!
customer_reviews.author: BRC

customer_reviews.title: Computing Power Makes Up For Loud Fan
customer_reviews.text: This computer is great, but it's obviously going to have some heat issues being so small. So in order to make up for those heat issues it's got a very loud fan. In class I get some funny looks about the fan, but as a computer scientist the computing power more than makes up for some odd looks. On top of that the fact that it's truly a bargain to get a screen with this resolution, computing power and a weight of under 3 lbs. I'd recommend this to somebody looking for a powerful ultrabook. (I chose this ASUS Zenbook over the Samsung Series 9, which my friend got and I'm having significantly fewer problems).
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Excelent product
customer_reviews.text: It is a super machine I love all the features it come with! XD It is the laptop Perfect for work!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Zenbook Prime UX31A
customer_reviews.text: Great screen quality - very fast - nice feel to keybord - touchpad OK but not in same class as Apple MacBook Air
customer_reviews.author: G from Ontario

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: have a little serie problem with the keyboard, my suggestion is the a newer model
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Marchetti

customer_reviews.title: How To Get Your HDMI Port To Work
customer_reviews.text: Like many of you who have been frustrated by the failure of the Intel HD4000 HDMI port, I searched the Internet for hours looking for solutions. I tried them all; more expensive and less expensive cables, downloading the latest driver and prayer. Nothing worked. I finally came across a post on the Intel site which suggested that the mini-HDMI socket was recessed too far (a design flaw) such that the tip of the cable was not making the necessary connection. I took a cheap cable and cut off about 2mm of the plastic tip covering. PRESTO...instant recognition on by my 3D, HD TV. My Asus runs Windows Home Premium 64 bit.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: The touchpad is horrible, the worst I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this laptop. I have no idea how the touchpad passed QA, it's *that bad*. It's either too sensitive, too insensitive, or randomly sensitive. This is especially annoying because otherwise, the laptop is *fantastic*. I'm really considering selling it and getting something else, it's that bad. *grr*
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Defective Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box the keyboard was defective: The "d" , "backspace" and "delete" key did not register. Sent back after confirming with Asustek of the faulty keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: phusion

customer_reviews.title: pros / cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Light weight, good battery life, screen resolution is great, audio could be louder but is very clear. looks cool. Cons: Track pad is terrible, i have no idea how they could mess up the track pad this badly. sharp edges make for prolonged typing to become annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: review
customer_reviews.text: Real nice would recommend this PC to anyone you cannot go wrong the screen is awesome and it goes from startup in a rush
customer_reviews.author: L M Lewis

customer_reviews.title: keyboard :/
customer_reviews.text: as a student who does a lot of typing, it is extremely frustrating to have paid $1000 for a computer with a keyboard that doesn't work as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bonar

customer_reviews.title: Great ultrabook!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this ultrabook. Battery life could be longer but it's typical. Display resolution is 1920x1080. It's really high and you should note that not every application does scaling well.
customer_reviews.author: Anton Sokolov

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard failed in 6 months. Buy only if you can take risk.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the idea of a 13 inch, 1080p screen. Bought it despite some bad reviews. On usage did not like the keyboard or the touch-pad. Last week the some of the keys stopped working. Now I have to send it for repairs.
customer_reviews.author: Sandesh

customer_reviews.title: nice but has problem with the bluetooth driver
customer_reviews.text: bluetooth driver does not work on Windows 7 Ultimate 64bit. The support could not resolve this issue. So I have a proffessional computer without a bluetooth. All the rest works as described and I have not experienced any other problems.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ovtcharov

customer_reviews.title: Good notebook
customer_reviews.text: I like the design. But it seems a little hot when you try to run some large program. No noise is unnoticeable when it is quiet. However, the light leaks when I start this PC. Besides, my ssd is sankdisk.....
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Cao

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Am very pleased with this ultrabook, although having had it a short time, I have not yet explored all its possibilities. It is proving to be fast, easily transported and very useful to me. Pat S.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Schlinke

customer_reviews.title: Great for college student
customer_reviews.text: Great computer for the price. Small, compact but powerful. Perfect for a college student that needs a compact laptop. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kolb

customer_reviews.title: It looks awesome, very good quality built
customer_reviews.text: Had this over two years. Still looks new and runs smoothly. Fast enough for my needs. It looks awesome, very good quality built. The only minor issues would be the power cord is fragile, afraid it will snap anytime. And the power cord connection is old school. The fan is loud at times. Speakers a very low key.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: a nice notebook
customer_reviews.text: The ratio of quality to price is great, and it is so thin and light that it looks like a real 'notebook'
customer_reviews.author: i like the ux31a-ab71 ASUS ultrabook

customer_reviews.title: love this laptop
customer_reviews.text: perfect, exactly what i was looking for. blazing fast start up with the SSD. drive is a little small at 128gb, but i picked up a 128gb jump drive for pretty cheap and am completely satisfied. great looking screen, easy to type on. i have no issues at all
customer_reviews.author: Hendo

customer_reviews.title: great laptop
customer_reviews.text: fast speed...great display...everything it should be while I am not an expert, I work with laptops everyday and this is the best ultrabook
customer_reviews.author: philosophergirl

customer_reviews.title: some keys not working
customer_reviews.text: everything else is fine, except that my laptop backspace and delete keys start and stop working erratically, I dont know wy. does anyone else have this problem?
customer_reviews.author: soumya mohan

customer_reviews.title: ZenBook is what we expected.
customer_reviews.text: Laptop worked Great ! We did upgrade to windows 8 a little confusing but overall love the notebook. The note book is very light and look very slick..
customer_reviews.author: John And Family

customer_reviews.title: it is an expensive garbage.
customer_reviews.text: some keys did not work since I got it. it is an expensive garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Bin Ke

customer_reviews.title: great laptop
customer_reviews.text: this is a great laptop - windows 7, it arrived with a loose socket, tightened that up and all the keyboard keys worked great. very fast, sleek, super light, perfect for my needs. very responsive dealer - will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Get Real

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great Ultrabook. Solid construction. Great power. Sutil details. Very nice trackpad. Impresive screen. Awesome style. So, I really love it!
customer_reviews.author: Federico

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great performance, great display and graphics card, great multi-gesture touchpad. I cannot say anything bad about it and would recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: First...and last...ASUS purchase.  Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This $1,400 Ultrabook looks great on paper, but quality control apparently isn't implemented at the ASUS factory. The Notebook arrived with a non-functioning camera (searching on the Internet, I see others have had the same issue). After two hours on the phone with ASUS technical support, including a demand that I wipe the machine and reinstall Windows (which I did), they advised me to send the unit in for its first repair--two days after receiving it new! Shipping a device with defective components and apparently not testing before shipment is not a great way to start a long-term customer relationship, so I'm returning it to Amazon and starting the search all over again. VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this model and company
customer_reviews.text: This computer stopped working after the second time being turned off, it would not turn back on again. Customer service was so-so, little help and I had to fight to get a return authorization. They wanted me to back up my data on the computer, yet I could not turn it back on, and could not seem to grasp the idea I could not access the data. And since the box was opened, I can not get my money back and am stuck with a non functioning computer. Would not get this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Africa Joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very quick service. Had some problems after the arrival but the company helped me and everything was fixed very shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Defective ultrabook
customer_reviews.text: This laptop caused me to spend more money then I expected. From the time I opened the box, I had problems. I spent $28 to send it back to get it fixed. Still waiting for feedback on how my computer is doing. I bought it in July 2013 so that i can have it before school at the end of august, NOT GONNA HAPPEN. bad customer service and a defective laptop. Not worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Nice..!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is lightweight, thin, and has a very professional appearance. The keyboard is easy to type with, and the screen is beautiful. I just wished there were more USB ports, and some of the Fn keys weren't working. I got a refurbished/used one, so that could be the problem. But a lot of people have complained about that. Besides the USB ports and Fn keys I overall really liked this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Pang

customer_reviews.title: Really great but...
customer_reviews.text: Great aesthetics. FAST boot time. One BIG flaw: the trackpad. It's pretty much useless. As I type the cursor flies around the screen highlighting, clicking, etc. This is the behavior right out of the box. This does not happen on a Macbook. Why is it that no PC manufacturer can get this right. My fix is to use a usb wireless mouse. The Zenbook is pretty much great in all other aspects.
customer_reviews.author: William T Mellema Jr

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but had to use the 1-year warranty for a faulty power button
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I love this computer. It is very lightweight and thin. Fits easily in my backpack or just to carry with a notebook to work. The only downside was that 8 months in the power button stopped working. It was still under the 1-year warranty, but I had to shipping it to the manufacturer and wait close to 2 weeks before I received it back. No other problems since then.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Pros 1920x1080 resolution SSD i7 processor slim and sleek build ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros 1920x1080 resolution SSD i7 processor slim and sleek build. Cons: Reliability. 6 months after purchase, I started having intermittent problems turning it on. It just would not turn on all the time. Touchpad feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Levan

customer_reviews.title: My Commodore 64 keyboard worked better
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely computer that I received early September 2012. Except for the critical fact that after 2 weeks, some of the keyboard keys are intermittently failing to register: the C, the K, the Q, and the space bar. I emailed Asus support about 12 hours ago so hopefully I'll hear back from them soon. Why ruin a lovely computer with such a basic failing?!?! I want to keep this computer, but cannot if this continues. (Yes, for some reason the keys are working now as I type this, but they often weren't working for the previous 2 days.)
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: I try to buy, and the results give me the result!
customer_reviews.text: Arrival, the computer has no sound, never buy! ! ! Is a bad computer. Amazon how do such a thing? ? ? I am a Chinese customer, not replace, but also not back. Only to repair it.
customer_reviews.author: zhouji

customer_reviews.title: Great,
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good other then the touchpad. sometimes when typing it will jump to other parts of the page. But you can just turn off touchpad when typing. Very light very elegent, i5 proccessor. Def worth
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Y.

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: Have had my zenbook for about a month and so far, I'm happy. Like other reviews have mentioned, the touchpad is a bit too sensitive, so the cursor jumps around a lot, but apart from that it's a good machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Chau

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...for less than two months
customer_reviews.text: It worked flawlessly for the first two months, now it doesn't work at all. When I try to power it on, the Caps Lock and Power light turn on but the computer never boots. There are forums with dozens of people complaining about the same problem, the only solution is to send it in to Asus. I would not recommend this laptop to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop with One Giant Flaw
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful laptop with the world's worst touchpad software. Found replacement driver software at Samsung, and now it works fine. Larry Nichols
customer_reviews.author: Larry D. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop. Minor bugs with power connection on motherboard and keyboard connection.
customer_reviews.author: Severin S.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Asus, customer service as bad as Dell.
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy Asus productsd all the time. I recently bought a Zenbook. Great computer, until the power socket went bad. It took two weeks for them to get back to me with an RMA number. Had to pay for shipping, then the service center sent me an email saying they wanted me to pay for shipping back. Got it back, but had other problems. 6 weeks later, I have been able to use it for less than two of them. Their only answer is "Call and get an RMA and send it back for repair. They won't refund or replace it or send me a temporary to use. I will never buy Asus again.
customer_reviews.author: Asus gives lousy customer service

customer_reviews.title: Fail just made an ultrabook, Keyboard Defective on 2 units
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is fabulous and I want to love it Soooooo Much. The screen is the best I've ever seen in 13" and I'm fighting to get one that works. HOWEVER< I'm returning my second until because the keyboard key's do not all work. There is just no living with this and plants a LOT of doubt in this laptop. I would suggest getting the 3 year warranty because I find it hard to believe this lasting long with these quality control issues.
customer_reviews.author: Adam McFamilyManly
